title: Boston.com readers are mostly happy, but the unhappy ones have a lot of feelings

title: Healey’s GOP rivals want to put the brakes on state flag change
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “When I’m elected Governor, we’ll keep the Massachusetts flag and our historic motto,” an opponent to Healey wrote on X.
The Massachusetts state flag, along with the Pride flag, flown in June.

title: In Tanner Jeannot, Bruins believe they have far more than just a bruiser on the ice
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins “I want to just help out as much as I can with being a leader to some of the younger guys.

title: Red Sox prospect Connelly Early will start his first game at Fenway Park this week
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox Boston's reshuffled rotation has Garrett Crochet in line to start the Red Sox's first postseason game later this month.
Early struck out 11 batters in his first MLB start last week.

AP Photo/Scott Marshall By Conor Ryan September 15, 2025 2 minutes to read After dominating the Athletics in his first big-league start last week, Red Sox prospect Connelly Early is set to face the A’s once again in his second outing with Boston.

title: Close Boston City Council race in District 7 could go to a recount
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Politics In the uniquely tight race, the top five candidates all came within 1.
38 percentage points of each other.
Two move forward to the November general election.

title: Drake Maye talks silencing critics, Mike Vrabel’s sideline sprint, and more on WEEI
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots "It literally took everybody yesterday.
Special teams, offense, defense, coaching.

title: Maine assistant principal dies after fiery crash during alleged police chase
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “This news is incredibly difficult for us to process as a staff, and may be very difficult for your child as well," the school superintendent told families.

By Molly Farrar September 15, 2025 | 5:55 PM 2 minutes to read Classes were canceled at a Maine high school after a 34-year-old educator died in a fiery crash while allegedly speeding away from police Saturday night, officials said.
Jacob Brown, of Scarborough, was an assistant principal at Scarborough High School, a suburb just south of Portland, the district confirmed.

title: More than 3,400 voted: These finalists rose to the top for state flag, seal, and motto
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Readers Say More than 3,400 readers responded to our poll — and they didn't hold back.
The three highest-scoring options for the new Massachusetts state seal released last month by the Seal, Flag, and Motto Advisory Commission.
